task_summary: Single-arm fold of a small cloth by aligning, making contact, and performing two pushing strokes to create a crease, then retreating.

task_long_description.overview: A PR2-like manipulator folds a pink cloth lying on a tabletop. The robot first localizes the cloth, approaches from above, orients its tool to match the cloth edge, and achieves light contact. Instead of a lift-and-place grasp, the fold is induced by two short pushes along a diagonal to flip part of the cloth over itself. The sequence emphasizes alignment, gentle contact, and repeatable short motions to form a crease before retreating to a safe height. The arm operates with an open gripper, using contact and planar pushing to realize the fold.
preconditions: Cloth is present on the table within reachable workspace
No objects obstruct the approach path
End-effector is free; gripper can open
stepwise_plan: Open gripper and move to a pre-contact pose above the cloth.
Set tool yaw and align to the edge/diagonal.
Lower until gentle contact with the table/cloth.
Execute two short diagonal pushes with brief pauses to form a crease.
success_criteria: Visible crease with part of the cloth folded over itself
Robot ends clear of the cloth without disturbing the final fold
No collision except intentional low-force contact
failure_and_recovery: Misalignment: re-approach and realign before pushing.
Insufficient fold: repeat push strokes if needed.
Excessive slip: reduce push distance or adjust yaw, then retry.
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after retreat once the fold is formed and no further actions are required.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Locate the cloth in the scene.
Ensure gripper is open for non-grasp contact.
Move to a pre-contact height over the cloth.
Orient tool to align with cloth edge/diagonal.
Short pause between push strokes to settle cloth.
Back away to clear the workspace after folding.

failure_modes: Cloth not detected or partially occluded
Push distance too short/long leading to poor crease
Contact too strong causing cloth displacement
recovery_strategy: Retry detection up to three times
Adjust push distance or repeat strokes
Reestablish gentle contact with reduced depth
assumptions: Folding is achieved via planar pushing rather than lift-and-place grasping.
